description.narrative: The Programme will support the achievement of target 10.c of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), aiming to reduce to less than 3 percent the transaction costs of migrant remittances. It will also directly support the member states in implementing Objective 1 (data for evidence-based policy), 19 (harness the benefits of migration as a source of sustainable development, 20 (promote faster, safer and cheaper transfer of remittances), and 21 (developing financial safety net and wealth stock for migrants and their families) of the Global Compact of Safe, Orderly, and Regular Migration (GCM). The Programme will also address the commitments related to migration and remittances within the Joint Labour Migration Programme (JLMP), adopted by African Heads of State with an aim to strengthen the capacity of regional actors, including private sector, and exhibit a unifying approach needed to optimize the positive impact of migration. Sida is a supporter of the JLMP. The Goal of the Programme is to contribute to regional harmonization of remittance policies and availability of affordable, accessible, reliable, and tailored digital remittances and financial products to female and male migrants towards their economic inclusion, financial resilience, and reduced inequality.

participating-org.narrative: Sweden, through Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida)
